programme.title: Wildest India: Thar Desert: Sacred Sands

programme.title: Wildest Indochina: Cambodia: The Water Kingdom

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Motherlode
programme.desc: Augur is caught and placed in a special prison where he is placed in a sensory deprivation chamber. An amoralist gets him out and wants Augur to help him steal the gold Zo'or has on the mothership. When Liam learns of what happened he tries to find Augur.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Take No Prisoners
programme.desc: The ANA negotiate amnesty for all resistance members, Liam tries to convince resistance member Halley Simmons to take the offer. Sandoval uses parasites to make volunteers do suicide missions against the resistance.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Second Wave
programme.desc: The Taelons decide to leave Earth when it appears that the Jiridians are invading. Meanwhile, a group of Resistance prisoners saved from the mother ship include several disguised Jiridians who are causing trouble for Liam and Renee.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Essence
programme.desc: Renee's brother has PTSD. In a desperate effort to help him, she agrees to let him undergo special treatment. The treatment removes his emotion. The project is overseen by Sandoval and the emotion they take is given to Da'an.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Phantom Companion
programme.desc: While on board the mothership, Renee sustains an injury and while being treated, she gets pulled into the walls and disappears.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Dream Stalker
programme.desc: Street asks Liam to help a friend who's arrested for the murder of a man he hated. Liam talks to him and he claims that he dreamed of killing him.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Knife
programme.desc: Malone's time in the spirit realm has given him psychic abilities. When he and Challenger discover a morbid campsite, Malone is encouraged to use his new powers to solve the case of Jack the Ripper.

programme.title: The Lost World: Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: A dying stranger issues a warning to three of the explorers, begging them to find a hunter named Pierson Rice. Roxton shares a common, painful past with the mysterious Rice.

programme.title: The Lost World: Dead Man's Hill
programme.desc: Roxton stumbles into a bizarre Wild West alternate reality when he finds his name on a tombstone. Roxton meets the other explorers' pioneer-town personas.

programme.title: The Lost World: Hollow Victory
programme.desc: Challenger experiments with a new fuel source in the hot-air balloon, and takes the other explorers along for a test ride. However, a storm drags the balloon into a dangerous underground world.

programme.title: The Lost World: A Witch's Calling
programme.desc: While Roxton and Malone search for the missing Veronica, two young witches lure them away from safety. Unbeknownst to the explorers, a sorceress and her disciples plot to destroy Challenger.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Rosemary Shrager and Jean-Christophe Novelli hit the road in a classic Ford Mustang. Margie Cooper and Paul Laidlaw help the chefs sift through bargains in Yorkshire, but will a passion for cookery-themed items land the chefs in hot water?

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: It's 80's superstar turned gardener Kim Wilde vs. Home Front in The Garden visionary Diarmuid Gavin. Helping them cut through the antiques undergrowth from Hertfordshire to Cheshire--in a Jaguar XJS--are Jonathan Pratt and Will Axon.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and Waldemar Januszczak turn things upside down on the experts. Teaming up against veterans Charles Hanson and Charlie Ross, it's Arty vs. Antiques through Cheshire and Staffordshire--in a stylish Jaguar XJS.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: It's day one of the new series! Anita Manning and Mark Stacey start their journey in Aberfeldy and head for auction glory in Dundee.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Catfish UK: Mario & Hannah
programme.desc: After turning his life around, Mario met his soulmate, Hannah. But she refuses to speak on the phone and won't meet in person. Julie and Oobah try to find out who his dream girl really is. (S1, ep7)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Emma & Harry
programme.desc: After six months, single mum Emma and online love Harry have already set a wedding date. But the problem is, they've never met. So it's up to the Catfish UK team to track him down. (S1, ep8)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Luke & Amy
programme.desc: Drummer Luke first started talking to nurse Amy when she came to one of his gigs 6 months ago. They had an instant spark but unfortunately every time they try and meet she cancels. (S2, ep9)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Rob & Sarah
programme.desc: Oobah is joined by Nathan Henry to help Rob track down his soulmate, Sarah. After two and a half years, Sarah has suddenly gone quiet and it's up to Oobah and Nathan to investigate. (S2, ep7)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Neil & Jasmin
programme.desc: Neil has been chatting to Jasmin for 3 years and she's stood him up 13 times. So it's up to Julie and Oobah to find out if the person Neil has fallen for...is real? (S1, ep2)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Jerry & Karla
programme.desc: Jerry needs help meeting his first love Karla. Karla claims to have already met Jerry but refuses to talk to him on the phone. Can Oobah and Nella find out if Karla is who she says she is? (S2, ep1)

programme.title: 48 Hours: Father and Son
programme.desc: A teenager makes a discovery that could prove his mother's death was not suicide.

programme.title: 48 Hours: A Cop Behind Bars
programme.desc: Patrick Bradford, was convicted of stabbing his mistress to death. Determined to win his acquittal, Deborah Nolan, a close friend, and staunch supporter of Bradford‚Äôs, quit her teaching job and went to law school to take on his defense.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Playing With Fire
programme.desc: In September 2002, two men were found executed in a burning Mercedes in an upscale Hollywood neighborhood. What initially looked like a drug-related murder, turned out to be something entirely different, but the crime scene left little evidence to go on.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Lost in Paradise
programme.desc: In 1976, Deborah Gardner, a Peace Corps worker, was murdered while on assignment in the South Pacific island nation of Tonga. Dennis Priven, a 24-year-old fellow Peace Corps worker, who appeared to be obsessed with Gardner, was charged by Tongan police.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Chasing the Barefoot Bandit
programme.desc: A report on Colton Harris-Moore, also known as the ‚ÄúBarefoot Bandit,‚Äù because of his habit of committing crimes barefoot and leaving chalk outlines of his feet; and whose exploits included stealing planes, guns, yachts, and escaping to foreign countries.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Hunted
programme.desc: Authorities in Colorado race to catch a serial rapist before he attacks again.
